label: Letter from Armant Legendre, November 14, 1943
description: Letter from Armant Legendre to his brother, Sidney Legendre, regarding his possible transfer to join his brothers at the Navy station in Pearl Harbor, Hawaii.

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: Letter from Armant Legendre to his brother, Sidney Legendre, regarding his possible transfer to join his brothers at the Navy station in Pearl Harbor, Hawaii.

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value:
IN REPLY ADDRESS NOT THE SIGNER
OF THE LETTER, BUT
COMMANDING OFFICER.
SMALL CRAFT TRAINING CENTER,
ROOSEVELT BASE, TERMINAL ISLAND.
SAN PEDRO, CALIFORNIA
U. S. NAVAL
SMALL CRAFT TRAINING CENTER
ROOSEVELT BASE, TERMINAL ISLAND
SAN PEDRO, CALIFORNIA
Sunday , Nov 14 , 1943.
Dear Sid-- I was just about to answer your letter saying that it "is all off"
when I now receive your later one saying "its in the bag". This is your "V"
letter dated Nav 7. You say your "Colonel" is now asking for me--have you 
switched to the Army ? Well mebbe this time it will go through. Isnt there
something I can do from this end ?
When all this started last February , I suggested to you that it might be
well for me to go to Washington and follow it up from that end, but you advised
against this. The reason I ask again is because Raoul Vallon [who is now here
with me ] had tried for several months to get out here and it was only when he
started working from both ends that results were forthcoming. That is, he had
Capt Huntoon ask for him at this end, and then he had his commanding officer in
New Orleans agree to his release from that job and had him write a letter to
Bupers agreeing to the release.
I think that I wrote you in my last letter that I had once more requested 
sea duty. Incidentally my knee is coming on fine and I took a special physical I
exam which I passed okay. Well anyway , the Capt agreed to release me for sea
duty around the end of this year as he figured by that time Raolu Vallon would 
be able to take over my job here. When your letter cam in yesterday I thought
I better go ses him to ascertain if he had yet received a request from Bupers
for me to go to Pearl Harbor. He said he had heard absolutely nothing. So I
told him I would like to join you two if such a request same in and asked him
if he would release me now instead of waiting untill the end of the year. I told
him I thought that Vallon could take over right new with the organisation that
I have built up. He said " I will see". Be wouldnt say definitely 'yes' or "no"
, but I think he would let me go if it comes to a show down as all the dirty
work has now been completed in my dept and the rest is just routine. I didnt
ask him to write a letter to Bupers saying that he would release me to go to
join you , as first I wanted to write you and find out if you think this would
be wise. What do you think ? If you think he should write such a let ter to
Bupers, what is the exact title of the outfit that I would be attached to and
should I mention my assignement there for any special duty. Also should I mention
that I'm being requested for this duty by "Colonel" so-and-so ? Untill I hear
from you I shall do nothing but keep my fingers crossed.
Did you keep those pictures of the children I sent you , or have you torn
them up ? If you still have them please return the ones that include Bobby
Phillips as my daughters want them for their album. Bobby is their "hero" and they
swoon at the very thought of him ! They are doing fine at Foxcroft. As usual
Anne is leading the entire school in marks. Kafrum is just "getting by". She tries
hard but just doenst have Annes brain , but she surely is the sweetest child on
earth. Olive had a letter from Miss Nolan saying "Katharines has the most lovely
disposition that I have had to handle in years". Guess she got it from me-- 
"sweet tempered Arma" they called me.
[End Page 1]
IN REPLY ADDRESS NOT THE SIGNER
OF THE LETTER, BUT
COMMANDING OFFICER.
SMALL CRAFT TRAINING CENTER,
ROOSEVELT BASE, TERMINAL ISLAND.
SAN PEDRO, CALIFORNIA
U. S. NAVAL
SMALL CRAFT TRAINING CENTER
ROOSEVELT BASE, TERMINAL ISLAND
SAN PEDRO, CALIFORNIA
You tell me to be sure and not come out in one of the new gray uniforns.
Put your mind at ease, as I dont own one. I only got around to buying one of
the snappy tropical worsted Kahkis a month ago, so I have to wear that out first
so I'm in hopes the war will be over before I have to buy any gray ones.
I'm enclosing the last copy of our base Newssheet thinking you may be
interested in seeing my noble picture . Hang it over your bed to scare malaria
mosqueitos away.
I had a letter from Gertie yesterday and she is complaining that there
isnt enough excitement in London, even in spite of the recent bombings! What
a gal ! Incidentally I read something in_this mornings paper where some big shot
predicted that the Japs would bomb Pearl Harbor in the next two months--mebbe I
better not be so anxious to come out after all !
Did I tell you that I have taken up tennis again ? I have playing about
two months now. I run at about half speed but it seems to be helping my knee
and by the time I get out there I will be able to scamper around as of of old
, taking balls that belong to m  partner and missing my own. If I could only
get Eastman to switch from the Army to the Navy now and come out with me we
could have a little double at ten bucks a set--- you dogs still owe me about
$50 as I recall it from that last game in New Orleans.'
Well so long my fine fat friends. Let me new whether or not I should
have Capt Huntoon write Washington saying that he will release me if I’m requested
by your command.
Arma
[End Page 2]
